Collision Dynamics: When the car collides with a block, it will transfer some of its kinetic energy to the block, causing the block to move. The car's path will be deflected depending on the angle and force of impact.

Block Arrangement: The blocks are arranged in a semi-circular pattern. The car will likely hit the first block it encounters and then interact with subsequent blocks based on its new trajectory after each collision.
